ratings.question_text: Your level of engagement with the course was:
What is your overall assessment of this course?
The course was well organized to facilitate student learning.
I received clear feedback that improved my learning.
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the level of <u>intellectual challenge</u> of this course was:
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the <u>workload</u> of this course was:

narratives.question_text: What knowledge, skills, and insights did you develop by taking this course?
comments: This course was helpful for supervising the writing of senior essays. However, the class expected prior research the major doesn't tell us to do before we enter senior year. We gave presentations and received feedback, and practiced peer review.

narratives.question_text: What are the strengths and weaknesses of this course and how could it be improved?
comments: This class has too many assignments that shouldn't really benefit seniors at this point in their thesis (e.g. review a presentation). The class did impose deadlines on writing our theses and presenting on them; that was probably the most helpful element. I would have appreciated more consistent thesis-writing deadlines throughout the semester (there was one for five pages, then a twenty-page final submission). Attendance wasn't strict/many people didn't show up most weeks, so the community element was a bit shaky. It was good to check in in a group each week.

narratives.question_text: Would you recommend this course to another student? Please explain.
